alert.note: Alert for Coastal Brunswick (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 26 at 12:27PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Brunswick, southeastern Columbus and central Horry Counties through 100 PM EDT... At 1227 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Goretown, or 13 miles northwest of Little River, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Shallotte, Sunset Beach, Iredell, Carolina Shores, Loris, Calabash, Bethel, Hickory Grove, Makatoka, Civie Town, Freeland, Nakina, Supply, Exum, Bughill, Longwood, Brunswick County Community College Main Campus, Nixonville, Ash and Goretown. This includes the following highways... US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 1 and 26. SC Highway 22 between mile markers 12 and 23. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
